item.title: Things That Could Drive Me Into a Nervous Breakdown
item.description: Photo by Ric Rodrigues from Pexels Nowadays, I have room in my heart for thinking about what could push me past my breaking point.

item.title: Incredible reasons I make a recommendation to apply to GSoC despite never got accepted
item.description: Unfortunately, as mentioned earlier I was not able to get into Google Summer of Code 2019.

item.title: Depth of module
item.description: Click here for Japanese version This article summarizes the concept of deep module described in the book “A Philosophy of Software Design” written by Professor John Ousterhout at Stanford University, and is written with permission of him.

item.title: Realization of distributed tracing by Envoy
item.description: Necessity of distributed tracing Since distributed architecture such as Microservices are handled across multiple services, it’s difficult to keep track of communication between services.

item.title: A choice to start small Service Mesh
item.description: Now, the architecture called Service Mesh is attracting attention in the Microservice industry.

item.title: Why was gRPC born?
item.description: The term gRPC became very famous, and articles such as “Introducing gRPC in house” and “How to build gRPC server” can now overflow.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there! I’m Ryo Nakao. I’m a software engineer, passionate about reducing the cycle time between an idea and usable software.
